title: 113_s2005
content: The Act may be cited as the "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013" and includes reporting requirements for certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is being amended to include changes in subsection (a)(1) related to hospital payment data reporting requirements. The Social Security Act is being amended to include changes in hospital payment data reporting requirements, such as moving subparagraphs and inserting new reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals. The Social Security Act is being amended to include new reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals to submit data on amounts collected from uninsured and insured patients for common procedures. The Social Security Act is being amended to include new reporting requirements for hospitals to submit data on payment classification groups for inpatient and outpatient settings. Data reporting must be transparent and publicly available online. The Social Security Act is being amended to require hospitals to publish data on collections and policies online for consumer comparison by zip code. The data must be easily understandable and hospitals must include a link to this information on their website. The Social Security Act is amended to require hospitals to publish data on collections and policies online for consumer comparison by zip code. The amendments made by this section apply to contracts entered into, or renewed, on or after the date of the enactment of this Act. The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission's annual reports to Congress must now include information on the percentage of charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends from certain hospitals will be made publicly available. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, will post data on charity care provided by hospitals on a publicly accessible website for meaningful comparisons by zip code. Medicare now requires hospitals to provide a link on their homepage to data that is easily understood by consumers. Medicare now mandates hospitals and critical access hospitals to include a link on their website to data specified in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. Effective immediately for new contracts or renewals after the enactment of this Act.
